6.title: Mark Trail
6.author: Ed Dodd and Jack Elrod.
6.series: Oct. 17, 1991) "McQuinn Drugged Andy and Took Him Away in a Canoe!"*
notes: Summary: Andy is home safe from his dognapping.

7.title: Mark Trail
7.author: Jack Elrod.
7.series: June 27, 1992) "Stupid Birdwatcher, He Could Ruin my Political Career!"*
notes: Summary: After ordering Mark Trail off his property, the politician pours himself a drink.

8.title: Mark Trail
8.author: Jack Elrod.
8.series: July 28, 1997) "But I Need Help With My Casting"*
notes: Summary: Pat tells Congressman Gates about her mother's anxiety to end the fishing trip, meets Steve Gates, and tells him she loves fishing. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Casting"

9.title: Mark Trail
9.author: Jack Elrod.
notes: Summary: Mark introduces Mrs. Kennedy to Congressman Jim Gates and wife Katey and their son Steve. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Congressmen"

10.title: Mark Trail
10.author: Jack Elrod.
notes: Summary: Mrs. Kennedy is happy to meet the Congressman and his family, and seems ready to give fishing a try.
Key words: Geese, docks. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Excitement"

11.title: Mark Trail
11.author: Jack Elrod.
notes: Summary: Mrs. Kennedy thinks she could get someone to take over as chairperson of the club dance, they'll get her fishing clothes and equipment, and Pat has her arm through Steve's.
Key words: Deer, docks. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Chairpersons"

12.title: Mark Trail
12.author: Jack Elrod.
12.series: Aug. 1, 1997) "Dangle a Congressman in Front of Her"*
notes: Summary: Mrs. Kennedy will soon be able to outfish her husband, who thanks Pat for her intervention.
Key word: Beavers, Bob Kennedy. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Congressmen"

13.title: Mark Trail
13.author: Jack Elrod.
13.series: Aug. 2, 1997) "Fishing is More Fun than I Imagined"*
notes: Summary: Mrs. Kennedy likes fishing, but likes her invitation to the Congressman's home for dinner even more.
Key words: Boats, competition.

14.title: Mark Trail
14.author: by Jack Elrod.
14.series: Jan. 3, 1998) "A Big Dog Saved My Life"*
notes: Summary: Mark sees a man in the hospital, who mentions a Saint Bernard.

15.title: Mark Trail
15.author: by Jack Elrod.
15.series: Jan. 6, 1998) "Mark Paddles South Toward the Old Man's Wilderness Home"*
notes: Summary: The big dog that saved the old man may still be at the cabin on Indian Creek Cove.

16.title: Mark Trail
16.author: by Jack Elrod.
16.series: Jan. 7, 1998) "As Mark Searches for his Beloved Companion, Andy, Not Too Far Away, Seeks Shelter from the Rain"
notes: Summary: Mark is canoeing in the rain and Andy has found a cave.

17.title: Mark Trail
17.author: by Jack Elrod.
17.series: Jan. 8, 1998) "In the Heavy Rain Andy Fails to See his Master Pass Not Too Far Away"
notes: Summary: Mark misses Andy, and meanwhile a wolf mother is being flooded out.

18.title: Mark Trail
18.author: by Jack Elrod.
18.series: Jan. 12, 1998) "Heavy Rain Has Swept a Young Wolf Pup Out of Its Den"
notes: Summary: Andy spots a cub in trouble, and swims out to help it.

19.title: Mark Trail
19.author: by Jack Elrod.
19.series: Jan. 19, 1998) "We Don't Have Time to Spend with a Puppy"*
notes: Summary: Joseph and his dad talk about a horse with a bad temper, and Joseph starts to ask if he can have a puppy.

20.title: Mark Trail
20.author: by Jack Elrod.
20.series: Jan. 21, 1998) "As Joseph Goes Out to Pick Berries, he is Suddenly Surprised to See Andy and the Wolf Pup"*

21.title: Mark Trail
21.author: by Jack Elrod.
21.series: Feb. 3, 1998) "While Recuperating from a Wolf Bite, Andy Appreciates the Attention his New Friend is Giving Him"
notes: Summary: Joseph enjoys Andy's company, but doesn't dare let his dad see Andy.

22.title: Mark Trail
22.author: by Jack Elrod.
22.series: Feb. 7, 1998) "I Hope You Find Your Dog, Mark, I Know How Much He Means to You!"*
notes: Summary: The newspaper editor agrees to print Andy's picture to help find him.

23.title: Mark Trail
23.author: by Jack Elrod.
23.series: Feb. 10, 1998) "Is This Dog the Reason You've Been Spending So Much Time out Here?"*
notes: Summary: Joseph's dad finds Andy.

24.title: Mark Trail
24.author: by Jack Elrod.
24.series: Feb. 11, 1998) "I Was Looking for Blueberries and He Just Showed Up!"*
notes: Summary: Joseph tells his dad how Andy chased the wolves, and how he bandaged Andy.

25.title: Mark Trail
25.author: by Jack Elrod.
25.series: July 14, 1998) "She Has to Appear in Court for a Sanity Hearing"*
notes: Summary: Mark and Rick are worried about the false evidence against Mary.

26.title: Mark Trail
26.author: Jack Elrod.
26.series: May 3, 2006) "Strange, He was So Anxious to Show Me His Pictures"*
notes: Summary: Grandfather wants to hear about the trip to the lost forest.

27.title: Mark Trail
27.author: by Jack Elrod.
notes: Summary: There was an explosion on the mountain, and pictures taken.
